issue.title: DRCSIM: Hand torque sensor - no X output

content.raw:
it appears bad parsing of [gazebo extension](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/1d6ceeb3915435d34941145afb110a1629ed691f/ros/atlas_description/urdf/atlas.gazebo?at=default#cl-84) and [gazebo extension](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/1d6ceeb3915435d34941145afb110a1629ed691f/ros/atlas_description/urdf/atlas.gazebo?at=default#cl-308) ends up generating two `<physics>` blocks:
~~~
<physics>
  <ode>
    <provide_feedback>0</provide_feedback>
    <cfm_damping>1</cfm_damping>
  </ode>
</physics>
<physics>
  <ode>
    <provide_feedback>1</provide_feedback>
    <cfm_damping>0</cfm_damping>
  </ode>
</physics>  
~~~

which ends up calling [Joint::ApplyDamping](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/096ec69b95bea437126f3b5acfaf0e6af1865d25/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc?at=default#cl-1189) even if `cfm_damping` is set to true.  As a result, `Joint::ApplyDamping` resets `Joint::forceApplied` and thus, torque about the actuated joint is very small.

This is fixed by [this gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/513/fix-parsing-of-providefeedback-and/diff).
